availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Ballenger Marshall. Father of Robert Marshall, John J. Marshall, Pendleton Marshall, Susan S. Marshall, Joseph F. Marshall, and Sarah A. Marshall. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Employed John J. Marshall as a farm worker in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 2, p. 337A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 496.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Pike County, Pittsfield, p. 327B.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA, Film # 7016188: All Counties: Kenton County, 1916, File #23594, p. 499 of 3309 of microfilm.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (Death Records - Large Cities (1852-1910), KDLA, Film #7007125: Newport, (1885), p. 282 of 885 of microfilm.
